page.title: 10PYEFLEET OYSTERS/COLCHESTER
page.content: Colchester has been famous for oysters since Roman times.The waters at Pyefleet Channel are warm and shallow and the mud is rich in algae and plankton,on which the oysters feed.The Pyefleet Channel is the property of Colchester Borough Council,who in the twelth century bought it from Richard I,who was raising money for the Crusades.The Colne Oyster Fishery Company rent it from them. Every year in September the Mayor of Colchester visits the Pyefleet,going out in a dredger to dredge up the first of the season's oysters. Even more famous is the Oyster Feast at which the Mayor presides and to which local and national dignitaries are invited.Oysters from the Pyefleet form an important item of the menu.
